intro: Mammillaria humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt pincushion cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and a dense covering of white, woolly spines. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–15 centimeters and features a ribbed stem with prominent areoles. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange and bloom in late spring or early summer. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
